definition: to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
journey/trip/expedition/to go on long campaign/to attack

sentences.english: She stood still as a mother seeing off the son heading to the battle field.
sentences.chinese: 她筆直地站着，如同一位送子出征的母親。

sentences.english: We played an intra-squad scrimmage and it was a better game than the NBA All-Star game.
sentences.chinese: 這一次他能夠代表美國隊出征真是一件非常好的事情。

sentences.english: Cao, infuriated, ordered him to the battle front, hoping the enemy's sword would kill him.
sentences.chinese: 曹操一氣之下，命他立即出征，借敵人的刀殺了禰衡。

sentences.english: As the new semester starts, i adapted the mood of soldiers going for war to Kampar…
sentences.chinese: 新的學期開始了，我帶着兵士出征的心情前往金寶。

sentences.english: Liu Xiang spearheads Team China to Daegu meet.
sentences.chinese: 劉翔領銜中國隊出征大邱世錦賽。

sentences.english: Cao， infuriated， ordered him to the battle front， hoping the enemy's sword would kill him.
sentences.chinese: 曹操一氣之下，命他立即出征，借敵人的刀殺了禰衡。

sentences.english: In the end the Emperor decided to temporarily stop the expedition.
sentences.chinese: 最終唐太宗決定暫時停止這次出征。

sentences.english: The Warring States era, a father and his son off to fight.
sentences.chinese: 春秋戰國時代，一位父親和他的兒子出征打戰。

sentences.english: Adm. yi sun-sin decided to lead half board house boat.
sentences.chinese: 之後李舜臣決定帶領一半的板屋船出征。

sentences.english: The tour is named after the weapon carried by Genghis Khan, the Mongolian emperor.
sentences.chinese: 這一名稱出自蒙古聖祖成吉思汗出征時所攜之武器名。

sentences.english: The first rider stayed at his last station until it was time for his next job.
sentences.chinese: 第一個騎手則在他最終到達的驛站上等待下一次出征。

sentences.english: In ChunQiu era, there is a father and his son going for a war.
sentences.chinese: 春秋戰國時代，一位父親和他的兒子出征打戰。

sentences.english: I'm always glad to represent my country.
sentences.chinese: 能代表國家出征總是讓我非常高興。

definition: to enlist/to draft/to conscript/to appoint to an official position
an expedition, esp. military/march to remote regions
to take to the field oneself (of emperor)/to take part in person in an expedition
the emperor leads his troops into battle (idiom)/to take part personally in an expedition
New Armies (modernized Qing armies, trained and equipped according to Western standards, founded after Japan's victory in the First Sino-Japanese War in 1895)
to go on a punitive expedition
